Starting at 6th level, you can tap into the grand equation of existence to imbue a creature with a shimmering shield of order. As an action, you can expend 1 to 5 @UUID[Compendium.5e-complete.5e-class-features.7hAcETWHOVguR2ZF]{Sorcery Points} to create a magical ward around yourself or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The ward lasts until you finish a long rest or until you use this feature again.

The ward is represented by a number of d8s equal to the number of sorcery points spent to create it. When the warded creature takes damage, it can expend a number of those dice, roll them, and reduce the damage taken by the total rolled on those dice.

Note: After adding this feature to your character, set Resource Consumption to Item Uses: Font of Magic to have it deduct sorcery points.

You can either change this feature to deduct more points before rolling, deduct points manually, or roll this feature once per point spent.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.
